Now, another big part of the this update is that it doesn't treat QA as one single perspective. Good QA means testing like your users, not like your dev team because what looks stable in house can fall apart the moment real people rush, misunderstand, or hit admin edge cases. Deep Agent is positioned as being able to shift into these perspectives on demand, which connects to one of the best definitions of QA. It's empathy plus paranoia. Empathy because you need to understand real user behavior. Paranoia because you need to assume the product will be pushed into edge cases and weird conditions. And that is where AI actually becomes useful because those perspective shifts are mentally expensive for humans to do endlessly at high intensity.
